intro: Atroxima gossweileri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its vibrant blossoms and compact growth habit. Atroxima gossweileri is often cultivated as a houseplant because of its ability to thrive indoors with proper care.
